2 (6 ounce) boneless salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1 tomato, thinly sliced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a piece of aluminum foil, and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Place the salmon fillets onto the foil, sprinkle with basil, top with tomato slices, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the salmon is opaque in the center, and the Parmesan cheese is lightly browned on top, about 20 minutes.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/374951.jpg

3 tablespoons Dijon mustard ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 5 teaspoons honey ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup fresh bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup finely chopped pecans ADVERTISEMENT 3 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT 6 (4 ounce) fillets salmon ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 6 lemon wedges ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 10 m Ready In 30 m Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a small bowl, mix together the mustard, butter, and honey. In another bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, pecans, and parsley. Season each salmon fillet with salt and pepper. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Brush with mustard-honey mixture. Cover the top of each fillet with bread crumb mixture. Bake for 10 minutes per inch of thickness, measured at thickest part, or until salmon just flakes when tested with a fork. Serve garnished with lemon wedges.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/3454021.jpg

4 (8 ounce) fresh salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT salt to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup cold water ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup seasoned rice vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon hot chile paste (such as sambal oelek) ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon finely grated fresh ginger ADVERTISEMENT 4 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 5 m Cook 20 m Ready In 25 m Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Season salmon fillets with salt. Place salmon on the preheated grill; cook salmon for 6 to 8 minutes per side, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Combine water, rice vinegar, brown sugar, chile paste, ginger, garlic, and soy sauce in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium and simmer until barely thickened, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle basil on top of salmon; spoon glaze over basil.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/1014163.jpg

4 (4 ounce) fillets salmon ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons prepared Dijon-style mustard ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup Italian-style dry bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 15 m Ready In 25 m Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a shallow baking pan with aluminum foil. Place salmon skin-side down on foil. Spread a thin layer of mustard on the top of each fillet, and season with salt and pepper. Top with bread crumbs, then drizzle with melted butter. Bake in a preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/174253.jpg

made it  |  484 reviews Recipe by: What a Dish! "This is a wonderful (and easy) recipe I got from my Aunt. The flavors of lemon and dill really complement the fish. I like to use wild Alaskan salmon for this recipe, but any salmon will work. I usually don't measure, so these are all estimates. Play with the ingredients to suit your own tastes!" Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1 pound salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 5 tablespoons lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon dried dill weed ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder ADVERTISEMENT sea salt to taste ADVERTISEMENT freshly ground black pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 25 m Ready In 35 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a medium baking dish. Place salmon in the baking dish. Mix the butter and lemon juice in a small bowl, and drizzle over the salmon. Season with dill, garlic powder, sea salt, and pepper. Bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until salmon is easily flaked with a fork.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/877476.jpg

1/4 cup butter, melted ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons Dijon mustard ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 tablespoons honey ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup dry bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup finely chopped pecans ADVERTISEMENT 4 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT 4 (4 ounce) fillets salmon ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 lemon, for garnish ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 15 m Ready In 35 m Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a small bowl, stir together butter, mustard, and honey. Set aside. In another bowl, mix together bread crumbs, pecans, and parsley. Brush each salmon fillet lightly with honey mustard mixture, and sprinkle the tops of the fillets with the bread crumb mixture. Bake salmon 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until it flakes easily with a fork. Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with a wedge of lemon.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/1104086.jpg

1 pound salmon fillets or steaks ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon onion powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried dill weed ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons butter ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 5 m Cook 25 m Ready In 30 m Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Rinse salmon, and arrange in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle salt, pepper, onion powder, and dill over the fish. Place pieces of butter evenly over the fish. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork.

1 1/2 pounds salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT lemon pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT garlic powder to taste ADVERTISEMENT salt to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 16 m Ready In 2 h 31 m Season salmon fillets with lemon pepper, garlic powder, and salt. In a small bowl, stir together soy sauce, brown sugar, water, and vegetable oil until sugar is dissolved. Place fish in a large resealable plastic bag with the soy sauce mixture, seal, and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat grill for medium heat. Lightly oil grill grate. Place salmon on the preheated grill, and discard marinade. Cook salmon for 6 to 8 minutes per side, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/679310.jpg

1 (14.75 ounce) can salmon ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons butter ADVERTISEMENT 1 medium onion, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2/3 cup cracker crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 2 eggs, beaten ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dry mustard ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons shortening ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 15 m Ready In 25 m Drain the salmon, reserving 3/4 cup of the liquid. Flake the meat. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium- high heat. Add onion, and cook until tender. In a medium bowl, combine the onions with the reserved salmon liquid, 1/3 of the cracker crumbs, eggs, parsley, mustard and salmon. Mix until well blended, then shape into six patties. Coat patties in remaining cracker crumbs. Melt shortening in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook patties until browned, then carefully turn and brown on the other side.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/2430433.jpg

1/4 cup brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons lemon pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried thyme ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried parsley ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder ADVERTISEMENT 4 (6 ounce) salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 1 h 20 m Whisk together the brown sugar, olive oil, soy sauce, lemon pepper, thyme, basil, parsley, and garlic powder in a bowl, and pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add the salmon fillets, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, turning occasionally. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate. Remove the salmon from the marinade, and shake off excess. Discard the remaining marinade. Grill the salmon on the preheated grill until browned and the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes on each side.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/310162.jpg

I serve them as snacks, sandwiches, or as dinner with rice and a veggie on the side. Personally I like to dip them in horseradish and snack away!! Hope you like them." Added to shopping list. 1 (14.75 ounce) can salmon, drained and flaked ADVERTISEMENT 2 eggs, beaten ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup garlic and herb seasoned dry bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup dry potato flakes ADVERTISEMENT 1 medium onion, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 clove garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon dried dill weed ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon celery salt ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons olive oil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 10 m Ready In 45 m In a medium bowl, mix salmon, eggs, garlic and herb seasoned dry bread crumbs, dry potato flakes, onion, garlic, dill weed, celery salt, salt, and pepper. Form the mixture into 2 inch balls, and flatten into patties about 1/2 inch thick. Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. In batches, cook patties about 5 minutes on each side, until lightly browned.

8 (4 ounce) fillets salmon ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup peanut oil ADVERTISEMENT 4 tablespoons soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 4 tablespoons balsamic vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 4 tablespoons green onions, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 3 teaspoons brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon sesame oil ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 20 m Ready In 6 h 40 m Place salmon filets in a medium, nonporous glass dish. In a separate medium bowl, combine the peanut oil, soy sauce, vinegar, green onions, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, sesame oil and salt. Whisk together well, and pour over the fish. Cover and marinate the fish in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours. Prepare an outdoor grill with coals about 5 inches from the grate, and lightly oil the grate. Grill the fillets 5 inches from coals for 10 minutes per inch of thickness, measured at the thickest part, or until fish just flakes with a fork. Turn over halfway through cooking.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/527453.jpg

1 (14.75 ounce) can salmon, drained and flaked ADVERTISEMENT 1 small onion, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 egg ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup fresh bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon hot pepper sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour for coating ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup butter ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons olive oil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 40 m Combine salmon, onion, egg, bread crumbs, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, black pepper, cheese and parsley; mix well. Shape into four patties. Dust lightly with flour. Chill for 20 minutes. In a large skillet heat butter and olive oil over medium high heat. Cook the patties until browned on both sides, about 10 minutes. Drain briefly on paper towels before serving.

2 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 6 tablespoons light olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried basil ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 (6 ounce) fillets salmon ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 45 m Ready In 2 h In a medium glass bowl, prepare marinade by mixing garlic, light olive oil, basil, salt, pepper, lemon juice and parsley. Place salmon fillets in a medium glass baking dish, and cover with the marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator about 1 hour, turning occasionally. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place fillets in aluminum foil, cover with marinade, and seal. Place sealed salmon in the glass dish, and bake 35 to 45 minutes, until easily flaked with a fork.

2 pounds salmon fillets, with skin ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons rice vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon packed brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons minced onion ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon sesame oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups long-grain white rice ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried dill weed ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups water ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 30 m Ready In 1 h 45 m Make several shallow slashes in the skinless side of the salmon fillets. Place fillets skin-side down in a glass baking dish. In a medium bowl, whisk together the olive oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, pepper, onion and sesame oil. Pour the liquid over the salmon, cover, and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium saucepan, combine the rice, water, and dill weed. Cover pan, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cook 20 minutes, until rice is tender and water has been absorbed. Allow to stand for 5 minutes before removing lid and fluffing rice with a fork. Remove cover from salmon, and bake the fish and the marinade for about 30 minutes, or until fish can be flaked with a fork. Serve salmon over the rice, and pour sauce over.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/114508.jpg

made it  |  43 reviews Recipe by: GIR1IEQ "This is an extremely simple, but very enjoyable main course. I generally stick it in the oven, then make potato wedges or my squash (sauteed yellow squash and zucchini) while it's baking. I began using sage on salmon during my college years, when I grew entirely too much of the herb, and put it in pretty much everything. It became my favorite herb, and lends a delicate and unexpected taste and scent to this dish. I tend to cook the salmon in the oven during the winter, but grilling works nicely as well, especially charcoal grills." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

Prep 15 m Cook 25 m Ready In 40 m Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Spray two large pieces of aluminum foil with cooking spray. Place salmon fillet on top of one piece of foil. Sprinkle salmon with salt, pepper, garlic and chopped dill. Arrange lemon slices on top of fillet and place a sprig of dill on top of each lemon slice. Sprinkle fillet with chopped scallions. 6 (5 ounce) salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT 4 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon white wine ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon honey ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup balsamic vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 4 teaspoons Dijon mustard ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Coat a small saucepan with non-stick cooking spray. Over medium heat, cook and stir garlic until soft, about 3 minutes. Mix in white wine, honey, balsamic vinegar, mustard, and salt and pepper. Simmer, uncovered, for about 3 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Arrange salmon fillets on foil-lined baking sheet. Brush fillets with balsamic glaze, and sprinkle with oregano. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 14 minutes, or until flesh flakes easily with a fork. Brush fillets with remaining glaze, and season with salt and pepper. Use a spatula to transfer fillets to serving platter, leaving the skin behind on the foil.

3 (12 inch) untreated cedar planks ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon sesame oil ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped green onions ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger root ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 2 (2 pound) salmon fillets, skin removed ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 20 m Ready In 35 m Soak the cedar planks for at least 1 hour in warm water. Soak longer if you have time. In a shallow dish, stir together the vegetable oil, rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, green onions, ginger, and garlic. Place the salmon fillets in the marinade and turn to coat. Cover and marinate for at least 15 minutes, or up to one hour. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat. Place the planks on the grate. The boards are ready when they start to smoke and crackle just a little. Place the salmon fillets onto the planks and discard the marinade. Cover, and grill for about 20 minutes. Fish is done when you can flake it with a fork. It will continue to cook after you remove it from the grill.

2 (12 inch) untreated cedar planks ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup pineapple juice ADVERTISEMENT 1/3 cup soy sauce ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons white vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup honey ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup packed brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon paprika ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder ADVERTISEMENT 6 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless salmon fillets ADVERTISEMENT 1 pinch salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 30 m Ready In 1 h 45 m Soak the cedar planks in warm water for 1 to 2 hours. Add a splash of bourbon to the water if desired. Bring the pineapple juice, soy sauce, vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil, and honey to a simmer in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and stir in the sugar, 1 teaspoon black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has reduced to a syrupy consistency, about 15 minutes. Set the sauce aside. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat. Place the planks on the grate. They are ready to cook on when they start to smoke and crackle just a little. Season the salmon with a light sprinkling of salt and pepper. Place the fillets onto the smoking cedar planks, close the lid of the grill, and cook for 10 minutes. Spoon a small amount of the sauce over the salmon fillets, and continue cooking until the fish turns opaque in the center, about 5 minutes more. Serve with the remaining sauce.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/1095418.jpg

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 30 m Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Arrange half the lemon slices in a single layer in a baking dish. Layer with 2 sprigs rosemary, and top with salmon fillets. Sprinkle salmon with salt, layer with remaining rosemary sprigs, and top with remaining lemon slices. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until fish is easily flaked with a fork.
